fields.description:
The bitbucket messaging system allows for sending empty messages via the web interface, which in my eyes can be considered a bug.

I've hit the "send message" button two times, because I thought this would open the message form. However, I did not see the actual form already existed because of a combination of thin borders/bad screen/bad viewing angle. So I sent two emtpy messages without purpose. It would be good if bitbucket would at least ask for a confirmation before sending empty messages.

Jan-Philip

Could we implement a download metric for these downloads similar to the manual downloads?

I've attached a picture annotating exactly what I'm trying to convey.

Create a repo named: test

try to access: mrdude/test

You get infinite redirects.

You can however access your repo on:\\
MrDude/test

fields.description:
The "import repository" page does not make it clear that only the latest revision will be imported. This is frankly a little uninteresting.

It would be much more interesting to use hgsubversion to do the conversion. Bitbucket has a chance to add a much-needed graphical interface to it with nice input fields for the various things that can be configured with that extension. People also sometimes struggle with installing the Python bindings for Subversion and an online service would help here too.

Making a "proper" import like this would of course be much more demanding in terms of both CPU time and disk space, but I think you should consider it.
fields.summary: Import Subversion repository with hgsubversion

fields.description:
Bitbucket's header has been displaying the following message for 12+ hours now:

We're currently migrating data to a new storage array. Repositories will be locked and unavailable for only a few seconds during the migration.

----
Considering "only a few seconds" is the time frame referenced, my assumption is that someone just failed to remove the message. I've pushed a commit, which has indeed showed up on Bitbucket, which shows the repo is not read-only currently.

fields.description:
I had an incredibly bright idea! Well, not really but I thought I'd take a second to share it with you. Granted, I have no inkling if an idea like this is even in the works right now within Atlassian but I figured I'd let you know. Github just introduced a GUI git client that lets you drag-and-drop repos into a handy-dandy little interface. It also links up to your github account and lets you do all of your repository management right within a tidy little desktop application.

I think that something like this would be excellent for bitbucket as well! Bitbucket is a far superior service and as such should have at least the same types of tools available if not better ones. I'd go so far as to say I'd be willing to write this client myself with the REST API; however, I figured I'd ask if something like this was already in the works before I got started and to see if their was community interest. I'd probably start with the Mac OS version since, well... I use a Mac and am completely self-serving.

Cheers!
fields.summary: Bright Idea!

Solution 1: the create issue button is not disabled but it asks for a confirmation to create a new issue when the user clicks on it.

Solution 2: the create issue button does not appear when the user reports an issue

fields.description:
Good morning,

Unfortunately I get the following error when trying to amend (add new comment) to one of my bitbucket issues:

{{{\\
Forbidden (403)

CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.

You are seeing this message because this HTTPS site requires a 'Referer header' to be sent by your Web browser, but none was sent. This header is required for security reasons, to ensure that your browser is not being hijacked by third parties.

If you have configured your browser to disable 'Referer' headers, please re-enable them, at least for this site, or for HTTPS connections, or for 'same-origin' requests.

More information is available with DEBUG=True.\\
}}}

I'm running Windows 7 SP1 x64 with Opera 11.50 (Build 1074).

Attached is a screenshot of my settings. I have also tried adding bitbucket as a security exception and trying form submission without a proxy.

Please fix this ASAP (or if it's a problem on my end, tell me how to fix it).

Thanks,

Samuel Marks
fields.summary: [403] CSRF verification failed

Samuel Marks

Thanks,

Samuel Marks

Hey! Wouldn't it be nice to hide the respective field if no milestone, version and/or component has been added?

fields.description:
Details are as follows: I have my normal TortoiseHg to manage the Chinese text of several months, until properly used. Yesterday I found in one commit TortoiseHg stop working, after inspection I found that the day before yesterday and yesterday I added some text, leading to the text's diff view error crash when commit or in Workbench, thus causing this commit faild.I modified one of the other independent documents, and then commit these two files together , is that this unrelated file's diff view appeared first, I successfully submitted. But in the process, when I try to click that file of led to diff view crash, it will immediately crash again, after I submit this in WorkBench inside view, click on the files in question show that the diff view , WorkBench also crashed. View presented earlier times, which see the diff view this file can lead to crash WorkBench. But I said earlier, the method has been successfully submitted, future changes will not lead to crash UI, but if it is submitted several times to see that diff, it will then crash again.\\
But the strange thing is, I put that lead to a separate file copy problems out in another goal to create a test repository which test, modify, commit, it will not cause a crash. I began to crash after a few of those submitted by the new Chinese text on the inside attachments, please take a look. If necessary, I can put the entire local repository distributed developers to find errors.
fields.summary: Certain of some Chinese text's diff view led to UI crash

Personally I like Bitbucket, but it would be great to 'synchronise' / import a Github project into Bitbucket and visa versa. That way I (and the few others using Mercurial) can stay with Mercurial, the rest of the people can stay with Git.

It would be nice if I could just write in any language name, or else if there were an easy way to add language names to the list.

fields.description:
imagine you have:

* a master repo with master issue tracker for the sw project
* a forked repo with own issue tracker for the subproject that some developer is working on

the developer works in his repo as usual and uses {{{"Fixes BCLOUD-42."}}} in his commit comments to close {{{#42}}} in HIS issue tracker.

at some time later, you decide that you want to pull the stuff from the developer's repo into the master repo.

the master repo's issue service will then see {{{"Fixes BCLOUD-42"}}} in the comment of the pulled changeset and close the MAIN issue {{{#42}}} also (which is usually something completely different).

This is very annoying, because you manually have to fix all those issues afterwards.

The only work around I can think of currently is to disable the issues service before pushing changesets you pulled from another repo using its own issue tracking with issues extension.
fields.summary: issues service has conceptual issues related to pulls from other repos (BB-2403)

fields.description:
Because of other junk hosted on cloudfront I had blocked javascript from that domain.

As a consequence of that I unintentionally changed the status on https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issue/869/tortoisehg-nautilus-doesnt-work-at-all#comment-606881 .

The site generally works fine without javascript, but the existing status value do apparently not have the right default value in the html but depends on javascript. Please fix that so you have full graceful degradation.
fields.summary: allow the issue form submit to keep status even when JS is not enabled (BB-2348)

fields.description:
For new repositories, please enable the issues service by default, or provide option to enable it automatically when creating the new repository.

I can't think of any reason why it shouldn't be enabled by default, and if it's still listed as a service, it could easily be removed by anyone that doesn't want it...

fields.description: When assigning access to a private repository it should show you a selector of the people you are working iwth instead of an autocompleter of everyone on github.  There is no way to find out if you are giving access to the right person this way, how would I know if it's the guy I added or someone else?  And how would I tell what's his nickname?  it's really a flawed process and I think it should be fixed.

fields.description:
When an issue is "new" or "open", I get radio buttons for chosing the new issue state. That is great -- I can pick "duplicate" and enter the number of the master issue.

However, I can also set the state via a dropdown menu. That menu duplicates some (all?) of the options and makes little sense: there is no way to indicate the master issue when I choose "duplicate" in the dropdown menu.

I suggest only using radio buttons for this, that seems to give the best overview. The radio buttons should probably always be shown, even for "resolved" or "duplicate" issues.
fields.summary: Dropdown for issue state interact badly with radio buttons (BB-2093)

fields.description: It would be cool if accents were treated as their counterparts for searching.
fields.summary: Make the user autocomplete treat accented characters as their non-accented versions and vice-versa (BB-2363)

Bullet points in README are rendered badly in Firefox (BB-2304)

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/dreamkxd/llvm

fields.description:
Hello,

It would be neat if we could browse the different repositories by language (Python, Javascript, ... ). This parameter is already there when you create a repository, so I don't believe it would be a huge change.

Something like :\\
http://bitbucket.org/languages/python

Would show you a list of the repos "crafted with Python".

What do you think?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Browse/search repositories by language/name/keyword/etc (BB-39)

fields.description:
Hi BitBucket,

Love your service, but one thing that I really miss since moving from CVS to BitBucket/HG is the nicely formatted checkin emails we used to get from CVSSpam. We DO get emails from bitbucket, but the format leaves much be do desired. With CVSSpam, I was basically able to do code checks with nothing more than email in most cases... with your emails, I need to fire up a compare tool to do the code reviews.

Could you please improve the format of your checkin emails, using CVSSpam as an initial target to aim for?

Thanks,\\
Ed Eichman\\
Cambrils, Spain\\
BitBucket User: Amex
fields.summary: Improve format of commit emails to allow quick code reviews (BB-2272)

fields.description:
Hi,

I would really like to see more granular permissions added for both the source control and issue tracker.

My particular scenario is that I have a few private repo's and with private issue trackers attached and I don't want some users to be able to access the source code, while still being able to view or edit the issues.

With the current setup this is not really possible, so we don't give access to the issue tracker and if we had this we would dramatically increase the number of users that would access our issues.

From a business perspective I can't see any reasons why you would not enhance the permissions ASAP considering you can derive additional revenue from the increased number of users accessing private repo/issues; in a lot of cases this might be the difference between a free and paid plan.

I'm very keen to hear feedback and the possibility of when this might be added.

Thanks,

Glenn
fields.summary: More Granular Permissions

fields.description:
Hi, thanks for the awesome jobs on bitbucket.

We just setting up a private repository on Bitbucket, and I've just notice that the "get source" link on the top menu will always give me a download link to an ancient commit for that project. Seems that event though I am on a different branch now and default branch is no longer activated, that particular link will direct me for that default branch and download tip of that branch. The correct behavior should be download the tip of current active branch, isn't it?

Thanks.

I've also attache a screen shot to clarify what link I am talking about.
fields.summary: Get source download link will always download the lastest default branch (BB-2266)

fields.description:
Allow users to customize the issue priorities from the default list of:

* Blocker
* Critical
* Major
* Minor
* Trivial

in the overview of the issue tracker (https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues), there are little buttons with arrows under the priority and type icon.

i suppose, that they are for changing the icon, but they doesn't work in opera (11.50)
fields.summary: little arrow buttons in the overview are not working

fields.description: The new changes that you made to the issue tracker are nice, but with out being able to see version and milestone in the issue list then the system is completely unusable to us. Since these are the only customizable fields they are the most important fields to us.  Since we can not see them on the list of issues we have to open every single ticket to see its status.  Is there any way to customize what fields are shown in the list.
fields.summary: Milestone and version not showing on open issue list

fields.description:
considering the choices "trivial", "minor", "major", "critical", "blocker", this seems to mix up priority and difficulty somehow.

for example, if there is a some severely wrong information somewhere in a docstring, what is this?

is it "trivial", because it is easily fixed in a minute?

is it "major", because one wants to fix such easy stuff with high priority (esp. as it takes about not time to get this off one's desk)?

so, i suggest to split this:

difficulty: low, medium, high

priority: low, medium, high

when considering this, one finds that even this might not be enough.

if some issue is a lot of work to fix, but easy work, just saying difficulty low is correct, but not enough.

So we get this:

difficulty: low, medium, high

effort: low, medium, high

priority: low, medium, high

(and of course there is always some "unknown/unspecified" choice also)
fields.summary: priority values seem to mix up things, leading to misclassifications

fields.description:
good day

could you please return the ability to sort issues by their numbers?

thanx a lot.
fields.summary: ?- could you return the ability to sort issues by their numbers?

fields.description: When I set the state of an issue to open and assign it to myself (which I normally do in the same step), the Responsible field is blank in the list of issues.
fields.summary: "Responsible" field is blank when I assign task to myself

fields.description:
The entire title on an issue will not appear when looking at the list of issues.

Also, I can't see who is responsible. Nor can I sort by the person responsible.
fields.summary: Issue reported by is no longer showing the reporter

fields.description:
Currently their is very little conceptual difference between "new" and "open". The difference is really just that someone has "accepted" or "acknowledged" the issue. I propose that what is currently called the "open" status be renamed to "acknowledged" to better reflect the action.

"open" should still be a button on the UI, but (as it does currently) should show results for any tickets that are not any of the closed states (ie. lists both "new" AND "acknowledged")
fields.summary: Rename "open" status to "acknowledged"

fields.description:
I often can't read enough of the issue title as there are too many columns on the screen. It would be very useful to be able to choose which headings are shown.

Ideally the default headings could be set for the repository, and also then each user could set(/override) these settings their own settings for each issue tracker.

I say "for each issue tracker" as the settings I might want for reading over my own issues and likely very different to when I'm browsing someone else's issue tracker (when I don't care so much about the metadata)
fields.summary: Ability to show/hide issue tracker column headings

fields.description:
ha ha!\\
also I can send Message to my self to.
fields.summary: I can follow my self!

fields.description: I'm just seeing ID and the first word of the title if it's less than 4 characters.. Hard to use the issue tracker without being able to see the title..
fields.summary: New Issue Tracker doesn't show full name

fields.description:
The issuer title  shows incomplete or missing!\\
BCLOUD-11 Support Mac
fields.summary: Title shows incomplete or missing

fields.description:
To me the 'Commits' tab is the equivalent of the 'revision' graph in TortoiseHg, i.e. it is my high-level view of the repository. Currently however the commits tab does not show tags. This piece of information that is shown in the TortoiseHg revision graph is quite useful.

Would it be possible to show tags in the revision graph the same way that branches are shown (but in a different colour).
fields.summary: Show tags in 'Commits' tab (BB-2257)

fields.description:
I think the timestamp value in the changeset API may be incorrect.

I made a commit at Aug 3, 2011 11:58:31 (America/New_York). That timezone is currently UTC-4, so I would have expected a UTC equivalent time of Aug 4, 2011 3:58:31 (UTC). Instead the API returns Aug 4, 2011 5:58:31 (UTC) which is 2 hours different.

See https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/arothian/repoman/changesets/b7c8352fe97f54dfc207d4334be13082606ff6c5
fields.summary: Incorrect timestamp in Changeset API

fields.description:
I'm using the source REST api and noticing that the node value is wrong.

For example,\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild/src/tip/setup.py returns\\
"node": "<bound method HgFile.lastchangeset of <HgFile setup.py@8057f70567cc>>",.
fields.summary: Odd node value in Source API json (BB-2237)

fields.description:
Hi,

If I do

hg clone https://guidon@bitbucket.org/guidon/nagios-gw-newsip-mysql-replication

I then get

hg log

changeset:   1:06021c314999\\
branch:      develop\\
tag:         tip\\
user:        Guido Negro [guido.negro%40gradwell.com]\\
date:        Tue Aug 02 16:00:52 2011 +0100\\
summary:     Added plugin script.

changeset:   0:9ce965f65a1f\\
user:        Guido Negro [guido.negro%40gradwell.com]\\
date:        Tue Aug 02 15:59:19 2011 +0100\\
summary:     Default branch initialized.

But If I change to 'develop' branch on the bitbucket web page I get this message:

"Note: This is not the latest revision. For the latest view, go to tip."

And If I click on 'tip' I get directed to the 'default' branch page :/

This is not consistent?

Can you help please?

Guido
fields.summary: Website says branch is not the tip but it actually is

fields.description:
Bitbucket lacks the ability to define a working order for serializing the process of working off issues.

We would love to see a simple numbering field enabling the project leader to define, in which order the developers have to work through the issues.

This field should be seen in the issues list and enable the developer to sort the list by the order, the project leader defined.
fields.summary: Ability to define backlog order on issues (BB-2235)

fields.description: Allow the limit=X attribute to be greater than 50 issues.
fields.summary: Issue REST API is limited to 50 issues

fields.description:
I often find myself having to quote text in an issue and the lack of quote formatting in the issue tracker makes it difficult. The "{{{}}}" formatting doesn't cut it because it doesn't wrap.

Could we please have that? Or did I miss something and it's already there? I tried "> " and it doesn't seem to work.
fields.summary: Quote formatting in issue tracker (BB-351)

fields.description:
Example:  https://bitbucket.org/saintnicster/radar/changeset/a69568bc9c74

When viewing the page, the javascript used to highlight the - and + lines is causing the page to become unresponsive (unable to scroll down the page).  Commit is a text commit, so the changeset screen tries to view all changes.  When running in FF or IE, a popup is displayed saying that the script has become unresponsive (screenshot attached).  After clicking "stop script," I am able to scroll the page again.  No highlighting appear on the large entry.

Tested in Chrome 12.0.742.122, FF 5.0, IE 8.0.7600.16385
fields.summary: Larger changesets cause view screen to become unresponsive (BB-1802)

fields.description:
Link to Open Issues

https://bitbucket.org/DBA_Lab/epycar_smartid/issues?status=new&status=open

doesn't include On Hold .

Link to Closed Issues

https://bitbucket.org/username/project/issues?status=resolved&status=invalid&status=duplicate

doesn't include Wont Fix .
fields.summary: Link Open/Closed issues : add On Hold and Wont Fix. (BB-2184)

fields.description:
Issuestracker .

Changing Version from something to nothing,

summary reports old Version instead of **blank **.

es. https://bitbucket.org/DBA_Lab/epycar_smartid/issue/35/campo-relatedmessageid-in-caso-di-invio#comment-581760

Thanks

Bye

Luca(R) - DBA Lab
fields.summary: Issuetracker : change Version to nothing doesn't effect list. (BB-2183)
